articles.author: Saurabh Sharma
articles.description: Efforts to rescue 41 workers trapped in a highway tunnel in the Indian Himalayas for two weeks will be further slowed as rescuers are considering drilling through the last 10 meters of debris manually, an official said on Saturday.
articles.title: Manual drilling likely in last stretch to rescue 41 trapped workers in Indian tunnel

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The number of people killed by floods from heavy rains in Somalia has climbed to 96, state news agency SONNA said on Saturday.
articles.title: Death toll from flooding in Somalia climbs to nearly 100

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Pope Francis cancelled his morning audiences on Saturday because of mild flu, the Vatican said in a statement.
articles.title: Pope cancels Saturday activities because of mild flu - Vatican

articles.author: Lovasoa Rabary
articles.description: Madagascar's incumbent leader Andry Rajoelina effectively secured a third term after the electoral body (CENI) on Saturday said he had obtained the most votes in a presidential election marked by a low turn out and an opposition boycott.
articles.title: Madagascar leader poised for third term after boycotted election

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A fire tore through a shopping mall in the southern Pakistani city of Karachi, killing at least nine people, officials and local media said on Saturday.
articles.title: At least nine people killed in Pakistan shopping mall fire

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un inspected photos taken by the country's new spy satellite of "major target regions", including the South Korean capital of Seoul and cities that host U.S. military bases, state media said on Saturday.
articles.title: North Korea's Kim inspects spy satellite photos of 'target regions', US bases

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Japan detected the first case of highly pathogenic H5-type bird flu this season at a poultry farm in the south of the country, public broadcaster NHK reported on Saturday.
articles.title: Japan detects season's first bird flu case, to cull 40,000 birds - NHK

articles.author: Bassam Masoud, James Mackenzie
articles.description: Israel has received a list of hostages set to be freed from Gaza on Saturday by Palestinian militant group Hamas, officials said, following the release of 24 hostages during the first day of a planned four-day truce on Friday.
articles.title: Israel receives list of hostages to be released Saturday by Hamas

articles.author: Max Hunder
articles.description: Ukraine needs more air defences to protect its grain export routes as well regions bordering Russia, President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said on Saturday, as he addressed an international summit on food security in Kyiv.
articles.title: Ukraine needs more air defences to protect grain exports, Zelenskiy says

articles.author: Aimee Donnellan
articles.description: Sam Altman will return to the helm of the artificial intelligence firm after a torrid week of resignations. In this Viewsroom podcast, Breakingviews columnists explain how the saga has raised concerns about governance, the future of AI and an alarming cult of the CEO.
articles.title: Listen Now: OpenAI’s boardroom drama is far from over
